choices.C: when a connected server has more than one VLAN configured on its NIC
choices.B: when the switch receives a request for an IP address from an individual PC
choices.E: when a single IP address is configured on the switch AC
choices.D: when a wireless access point running in bridge mode is connected to a switch
choices.A: when the switch receives a BPDU from a connected switch

discussion.content:
Correct Answers: A, C

Answer A is obvious. Next is Answer C; PortFast enabled port can only support one data VLAN and one Voice VLAN. The port goes into err-disable once an 802.1Q frame for different data VLAN is detected.

discussion.content: function should be tx and rx on pairs 12,36

choices.D: the MAC address of Host C
choices.C: the IP address of Host C
choices.F: the MAC address of the router's E0 interface CF
choices.E: the IP address of the router's E0 interface

discussion.content: The answer is C and F.

questions.question_text:
Refer to exhibit: Which destination addresses will be used by Host A to send data to Host C? (Choose two.)
//IMG//
questions.answer_description: While transferring data through many different networks, the source and destination IP addresses are not changed. Only the source and destination MAC addresses are changed. So in this case Host A will use the IP address of Host C and the MAC address of E0 interface to send data. When the router receives this data, it replaces the source MAC address with it own E1 interface's MAC address and replaces the destination MAC address with Host C's MAC address before sending to Host C.

discussion.content: in my opinion D and E should be the answers. dhcp server will not try to assign network address or broadcast address to a client, you don't need to make any configuration for this

choices.D: IP address used by the interfaces
choices.F: designated IP address to the DHCP server
choices.E: manually assigned address to the clients
choices.C: IP address leased to the LAN
